intro: Humboltia schiedei, commonly known as the Schiedea humboldti, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, often found in moist, shaded habitats on forest floors. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth, waxy surface. Humboltia schiedei is known for its ecological importance in supporting local pollinators and its role in the unique biodiversity of Hawaii.
